images.name: Jim Harbaugh: Aidan Hutchinson will be the No. 1 pick in the draft
images.caption: Jim Harbaugh explains why Michigan DE Aidan Hutchinson deserves to be the No. 1 pick in the NFL draft.

articles.description: Jacksonville will have back-to-back No. 1 overall picks, while Detroit and Houston follow at the top of Round 1.
articles.headline: NFL draft order for 2022: First-round picks from 1 to 32, including Jaguars, Lions and Texans in top three

articles.description: Former Oregon QB Robby Ashford, the No. 168 prospect in the 2020 class, transferred to Auburn on Monday.
articles.headline: Auburn Tigers land second QB transfer in Oregon Ducks' Robby Ashford

images.name: All of Chubba Purdy's TD passes at Florida State
images.caption: Look back at Chubba Purdy's four touchdown passes during his time with Florida State.

articles.description: The Nebraska Cornhuskers have transformed their quarterback depth chart through the transfer portal, adding former Florida State Seminole Chubba Purdy to a group that includes former Texas Longhorn Casey Thompson.
articles.headline: QB Chubba Purdy chooses to transfer to Nebraska after leaving Florida State football program

images.name: Caleb Williams [608x342]
images.caption: Freshman Caleb Williams came off the bench to help lead Oklahoma to a thrilling comeback victory over Texas.

images.name: Kedon Slovis [608x342]
images.caption: Kedon Slovis announced he will transfer from USC to Pitt.

images.name: Lyn-j Dixon [608x342]
images.caption: Lyn-J Dixon had 104 carries for 635 yards and six touchdowns with Clemson in 2019, but has totaled only 52 carries for 238 yards in two years since.

images.name: Kai-Leon Herbert [608x342]
images.caption: Senior Kai-Leon Herbert was the No. 99 prospect in the 2017 class. He opted out of the 2020 season and has mainly been a reserve for Miami.

images.name: Marcus Banks [608x342]
images.caption: Former ESPN 300 cornerback Marcus Banks played in 23 total games with Alabama before entering the transfer portal.

images.name: Max Johnson [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: Max Johnson remains in the transfer portal.

images.name: Jadon Haselwood [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: Former Oklahoma wide receiver Jadon Haselwood can play a role in replacing Treylon Burks at Arkansas.

images.name: Quinn Ewers [608x342] - Copy
images.caption: Quinn Ewers will transfer from Ohio State to Texas, he posted on social media.

images.name: Oklahoma vs. Texas (Casey Thompson #11 of the Texas Longhorns looks to pass) [608x342] - Copy (2)
images.caption: Casey Thompson has entered the transfer portal.

articles.description: More college football players are entering the transfer portal each year. As the season winds down, we will analyze top players as they enter the portal and make new commitments.
articles.headline: College football transfer portal tracker: Top players, predictions, analysis, more

images.name: Bama's Christian Harris jumps in front of Book's intended target for INT
images.caption: Notre Dame QB Ian Book tries to find TE Michael Mayer, but Alabama LB Christian Harris jumps in front for the interception.

articles.description: Alabama linebacker Christian Harris has announced he will enter the NFL draft.
articles.headline: Alabama Crimson Tide LB Christian Harris says he's entering NFL draft

articles.description: After four seasons at Northwestern, quarterback Hunter Johnson is transferring back to Clemson -- a rare transfer to Dabo Swinney's program.
articles.headline: Onetime Clemson football recruit QB Hunter Johnson transfers back to Tigers after career at Northwestern

article.description: Freshman Robert Riddle threw for 316 yards and one score and ran for two more touchdowns as Mercer opened Southern Conference play by holding off Samford 30-24 on Saturday afternoon.
article.headline: Riddle has 3 TDs, leads Mercer to 30-24 win over Samford
article.linkText: Riddle has 3 TDs, leads Mercer to 30-24 win over Samford
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. -- Freshman Robert Riddle threw for 316 yards and one score and ran for two more touchdowns as Mercer opened Southern Conference play by holding off Samford 30-24 on Saturday afternoon. Cole Fisher booted three field goals, including a 33-yarder to end the first half, to provide the needed cushion for the victory. He hit from the 39-yards out and added a 41-yarder with 4:37 left in the game for a 30-21 lead. Riddle found Stephen Houzah in stride for a 73-yard scoring strike to take a 27-14 lead in the fourth. Mercer (2-1, 1-0) was thrashed by Memphis 66-14 in the season opener, then beat Jacksonville 45-3 before snapping an eight-game losing streak to the Bulldogs. Mercer last beat Samford in 1932. Tee Mitchell rushed for 103 yards and Marquise Irvin grabbed six tosses for 71 yards. Devlin Hodges threw for 291 yards with three touchdowns as the Bulldogs (1-2, 0-1) closed to 27-21 midway in the final quarter.
